snippet: In the course of birds’ evolution from dinosaurs, it appears that their skulls pulled a Peter Pan and stopped growing up.
abstract: Study in journal Nature finds that as birds evolved from dinosaurs, a subtle genetic change slowed or stopped the development of their skulls, so that they remained the same shape throughout life; this type of change is at the heart of a current understanding of how evolution proceeds.
lead_paragraph: In the course of birds’ evolution from dinosaurs, it appears that their skulls pulled a Peter Pan and stopped growing up.

headline.seo: Skull Analysis Charts the Changes From Dinosaurs to Birds
headline.main: In Analysis of Skulls, Following the Path From T. Rex to Falcon
headline.print_headline: In Analysis of Skulls, Following the Path From T. Rex to Falcon
